name: Eagle Wing Guest Motel

reviews.text: We like to be close to as much of the outer cape as possible, especially our favorite beach and restaurants and haunts. Eagle Wing was convenient and immaculate, and the the owners-staff are superb hosts. We were already familiar with the cape, but Joe steered us to a couple of our new top favorites, and he was instantly helpful -- on a Sunday afternoon no less -- when one of our car's tires was attacked by a lethal screw. The owners were so cheerful and helpful that for a moment we thought it the start of the season rather than the end of the season, when folks can start to weary of being hospitable.
reviews.title: Great hosts and place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I have been traveling to the cape for years. We decided to stay here because our usual spots were closed for the season. We were pleasantly surprised by the friendly staff, the immaculate accomodations, and the wonderful muffins, juice and coffee in the morning. The room was large and the bed very comfy. I would definately stay there again!
reviews.title: Pleasant Surprise!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was the second time to Cape Cod and our first time to the Eagle Wing Guest Motel. The hotel was easy to find, well marked and lite entrance. Upon our arrival we greeted by a cheerful host named Joe. He quickly explained that the motel had to offer with respect to coffee, tea and morning breakfast items. He also showed us a couple of restaurants to eat as we were looking for seafood on some tourist maps.
reviews.title: Revisit to the Cape

reviews.text: We stayed in a king sized room, the room was clean, bed was comfortable. It had a small fridge and a flat screen tv with an abundant number of channels. The WiFi worked fine and connecting was easy.
reviews.title: Great place to stay!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were pleased with how quiet it was considering we were adjacent to a 4 lane highway.
reviews.title: It wasn't what we expected it all

reviews.text: Nice welcome with very good briefing on local places of interest and recommendations for dining. Large bedroom with very comfortable king bed, fridge in room but not coffee facility (this available in reception). Bathroom fine with usual provision of one facecloth, hand towel and smallish bath towel per person. Ventilation therein only through the window and slow. Aircon in bedroom worked well. Stayed in Room 5 which even with the rear door open remains dimly lit due to the frontage being under a verandah shared with the garbage bin, a washing line, bicycle rack and the ice machine.
reviews.title: Comfy bed, dim room
Not your ordinary motel
reviews.text: We also found several ants in the room as uninvited guests who made their presence known by enjoying a night's feasting on our limbs. We had intended to mention this to the proprietor but he was busy with bookings when we left.

I would like to start by saying that all comments listed on trip advisor by others would be similar to mine therefore I will try not to repeat. We stayed for 3 nights, upon our arrival we were welcomed by the owners and given a couple maps of Eastham and the neighbouring cities with places to eat and visit.
reviews.title: The Best

reviews.text: We were very impressed with the cleanliness of the room and the grounds. My spouse made a comment about how the carpet in our room was spotless. We stayed at many big name hotel chains, some of them should come down to the cape and visit Melanie and John to get lessons on how to run a hotel/motel. Nothing luxurous about the rooms but perfectly clean and all in working order (a/c, fridge, cable color tv, even the FREE wi-fi) What else can you ask for.
reviews.title: Great place, great people!!

reviews.text: We had a problem with our water supply and within 2-3 minutes all was back in working order and John called our room twice to verify if all was good and to explain what caused the problem.
reviews.title: Eagle Wing

reviews.text: Lovely place to stay with great owners who truly care about the guest experience. Cleanest room I' ve ever stayed in with rear access to a deck. Breakfast was fresh and flavorful. Stayed there on our honeymoon 44 years ago. The place has been completly rebuilt. Will stay again on our next trip to the cape. Thanks again to John & Melanie.
reviews.title: Great stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I wanted to keep this place a secret but I guess it's too late for that !
reviews.title: Forget the rest--This is the Best !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My Husband & I usually stay at B&B"s when we travel but we decided to give Eagle Wing a try since the reviews were so good and we needed a short (2 night) get away.
reviews.title: Great Value and Location on the Cape
Very friendly
reviews.text: John & his lovely wife Malainie (forgive me if I spelled it wrong) made us feel welcome from the moment we arrived ., There was a jar of cookies on the counter and coffee & tea if we wanted it --a nice touch after a long drive.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were given the key to room 10 Which has a King Size very comfortable bed , the room is large,airy and is well appointed in every way and best of all spotless as is the bathroom with a slip free tub/shower ..
reviews.title: Simply the Best

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spend 2 very pleasant nights at the Eagle Wing Motel.
reviews.title: Friendly owner makes this a great place to stay

reviews.text: The owner was always available to help and give us tips about cape cod. The rooms were clean and spacious, very good home made breakfast and biscuits available the whole day.
reviews.title: We had a nice stay, in a clean and friendly surrounding

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at this property for 4 days in September. This is a family run business where the owners are visible, friendly and helpful. The room we had was ample in size and had a door that one could access the back of the property if you wanted to sit out doors. While the bathroom was a bit cozy, it was clean, the towels were of ample size and were thick enough to dry off with, not like some towels that have seen their better days, While the property is located along Route 6 we did not find the noise to be a factor when sleeping. The air conditioner unit appeared to be new, it was much less noisy than most other properties we stayed in. When the compressor came on the window did not vibrate like most motels.
reviews.title: Fantastic Experience

reviews.text: You park in front of your unit, there is no central hallway. We found the location to be convient to the National Seashore and other towns like Chatham, Wellsfleet and Provincetown.We would stay here again.
reviews.title: Nice stay at Eagle Wing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This property is fueled by owner pride. Check in was warm and friendly. Everything in the room appeared to be newly installed. The bathroom is blinding by its whiteness. The king bed was terrific. The rate cannot be beat. We stayed 3 nights and thoroughly enjoyed our stay.
reviews.title: Keep this a secret!!

description: The Eagle Wing Motel is a unique property that combines the personalized touches identified with a guesthouse or inn with the modern conveniences associated with a larger, more upscale facility. The philosophy of this quaint, quiet property is to provide clean, comfortable and hospitable accommodations and personalized services. It is conveniently located to visit and enjoy the entire Cape. The property is for couples and adults only and is totally NON-SMOKING.
